intro: Steris americana, commonly known as the American steris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are small and white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
